model

Class ModelImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.ModelImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Model

    public final class ModelImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Model
    This is the implementation of the interface model. This class use the Singleton pattern because the control have to generate only one model.
    Author:
    josephgiovanelli

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createArena(java.util.List<EntitiesInfo> entitiesInfo)
      This method instances the arena, that means any entities like hero, goal and any types of monster, platform ecc..
      static ModelImpl getModel()
      This method return the singleton, the instance of model.
      java.util.List<EntitiesInfoToControl> getState()
      With this method the control can get informations of any entities and use them like do he wants because are defensive copies.
      void notifyEvent(Actions action)
      This method notify to model the new action of the hero.
      void notifyEvent(Directions direction)
      This method notify to model when he has to change the direction of the hero.
      void putBullet(java.util.List<EntitiesInfo> entitiesInfo)
      If the @updateArena notify the control that there are some bullets to instance then this method can put them into the arena.
      java.util.List<EntitiesInfo> updateArena()
      The control can call this method in order to send the new quantum of time.

      • updateArena

        public java.util.List<EntitiesInfo> updateArena()
        Description copied from interface: Model
        The control can call this method in order to send the new quantum of time. The Arena is updated by moving the monster, modify the life of them and a component checks the collision.
        Specified by:
        updateArena in interface Model
        Returns:
        : with a communication structure this method communicate to the control the bullet of some monster that has shoots in order to he can instance them in the method @putBullet

      • createArena

        public void createArena(java.util.List<EntitiesInfo> entitiesInfo)
                 throws NotUniqueCodeException,
                        IllegalMonsterBoundsException
        Description copied from interface: Model
        This method instances the arena, that means any entities like hero, goal and any types of monster, platform ecc.. In this method are used the Builder pattern, the Factory Pattern and the Visitor Pattern.
        Specified by:
        createArena in interface Model
        Parameters:
        entitiesInfo - : is the object within the communication happen.
        Throws:
        NotUniqueCodeException - : throw this exception if there is a duplication of codes.
        IllegalMonsterBoundsException - : throw this exception if the monster is instantiated in a location not consistent with his limits.

        Description copied from interface: Model
        If the @updateArena notify the control that there are some bullets to instance then this method can put them into the arena.
